  name={<><a href="#aa4213c3ca7384db7b4015b9a675f552f">BuildDivEstimate</a> (SDValue N, SDValue Op, SDNodeFlags Flags)</>}>
Newton iteration for a function: <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F(X)</a> is X&#95;&#123;i+1&#125; = X&#95;i - <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F(X&#95;i)</a>/F&#39;(X&#95;i) For the reciprocal, we need to find the zero of the function: <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F(X)</a> = 1/X - A &#91;which has a zero at X = 1/A&#93; =&gt; X&#95;&#123;i+1&#125; = X&#95;i (2 - A X&#95;i) = X&#95;i + X&#95;i (1 - A X&#95;i) &#91;this second form does not require additional intermediate precision&#93; For the last iteration, put numerator N into it to gain more precision: Result = N X&#95;i + X&#95;i (N - N A X&#95;i) <a href="#aa4213c3ca7384db7b4015b9a675f552f">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

Newton iteration for a function: <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F(X)</a> is X&#95;&#123;i+1&#125; = X&#95;i - <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F(X&#95;i)</a>/F&#39;(X&#95;i) For the reciprocal sqrt, we need to find the zero of the function: <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F(X)</a> = 1/X^2 - A &#91;which has a zero at X = 1/sqrt(A)&#93; =&gt; X&#95;&#123;i+1&#125; = X&#95;i (1.5 - A X&#95;i^2 / 2) As a result, we precompute A/2 prior to the iteration loop. <a href="#a0c22ce54cb6ce7cbcb49c0f5522a1c81">More...</a>

### recursivelyDeleteUnusedNodes() {#a1fb03492a579f75d8e28babe08499162}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool DAGCombiner::recursivelyDeleteUnusedNodes (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N)</>}>
Recursively delete a node which has no uses and any operands for which it is the only use.

Note that this both deletes the nodes and removes them from the worklist. It also adds any nodes who have had a user deleted to the worklist as they may now have only one use and subject to other combines.

  prototype={<>SDValue DAGCombiner::distributeTruncateThroughAnd (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N)</>}>
Try to transform a truncation where C is a constant: (trunc (and X, C)) -&gt; (and (trunc X), (trunc C))

<code>N</code> needs to be a truncation and its first operand an AND. Other requirements are checked by the function (e.g. that trunc is single-use) and if missed an empty <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> is returned.

### MatchLoadCombine() {#ae9244306b038cfa33823364f5cf97b83}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue DAGCombiner::MatchLoadCombine (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdnode">SDNode</a> &#42; N)</>}>
Match a pattern where a wide type scalar value is loaded by several narrow loads and combined by shifts and ors.

Fold it into a single load or a load and a BSWAP if the targets supports it.

Assuming little endian target: i8 &#42;a = ... i32 val = a&#91;0&#93; | (a&#91;1&#93; &lt;&lt; 8) | (a&#91;2&#93; &lt;&lt; 16) | (a&#91;3&#93; &lt;&lt; 24) =&gt; i32 val = &#42;((i32)a)

i8 &#42;a = ... i32 val = (a&#91;0&#93; &lt;&lt; 24) | (a&#91;1&#93; &lt;&lt; 16) | (a&#91;2&#93; &lt;&lt; 8) | a&#91;3&#93; =&gt; i32 val = BSWAP(&#42;((i32)a))

TODO: This rule matches complex patterns with OR node roots and doesn&#39;t interact well with the worklist mechanism. When a part of the pattern is updated (e.g. one of the loads) its direct users are put into the worklist, but the root node of the pattern which triggers the load combine is not necessarily a direct user of the changed node. For example, once the address of t28 load is reassociated load combine won&#39;t be triggered: t25: i32 = add t4, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a>:i32&lt;2&gt; t26: i64 = sign&#95;extend t25 t27: i64 = add t2, t26 t28: i8,ch = load&lt;LD1&#91;tmp9&#93;&gt; t0, t27, undef:i64 t29: i32 = zero&#95;extend t28 t32: i32 = shl t29, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a>:i8&lt;8&gt; t33: i32 = or t23, t32 As a possible fix visitLoad can check if the load can be a part of a load combine pattern and add corresponding OR roots to the worklist.

### splitMergedValStore() {#a877e516e4b3a32587d4ceaa9a26e0b3d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SDValue DAGCombiner::splitMergedValStore (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/storesdnode">StoreSDNode</a> &#42; ST)</>}>
For the instruction sequence of store below, F and I values are bundled together as an i64 value before being stored into memory.

Sometimes it is more efficent to generate separate stores for F and I, which can remove the bitwise instructions or sink them to colder places.

(store (or (zext (bitcast F to i32) to i64), (shl (zext I to i64), 32)), addr) --&gt; (store F, addr) and (store I, addr+4)

Similarly, splitting for other merged store can also be beneficial, like: For pair of &#123;i32, i32&#125;, i64 store --&gt; two i32 stores. For pair of &#123;i32, i16&#125;, i64 store --&gt; two i32 stores. For pair of &#123;i16, i16&#125;, i32 store --&gt; two i16 stores. For pair of &#123;i16, i8&#125;, i32 store --&gt; two i16 stores. For pair of &#123;i8, i8&#125;, i16 store --&gt; two i8 stores.

We allow each target to determine specifically which kind of splitting is supported.

The store patterns are commonly seen from the simple code snippet below if only std::make&#95;pair(...) is sroa transformed before inlined into hoo. void goo(const std::pair&lt;int, float&gt; &amp;); hoo() &#123; ... goo(std::make&#95;pair(tmp, ftmp)); ... &#125;

### StoreRootCountMap {#af58c40db21656946a06725a6950b8903}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>DenseMap&lt;SDNode &#42;, std::pair&lt;SDNode &#42;, unsigned&gt; &gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;DAGCombiner.cpp&#125;::DAGCombiner::StoreRootCountMap</>}>
Map from candidate StoreNode to the pair of RootNode and count.

The count is used to track how many times we have seen the StoreNode with the same RootNode bail out in dependence check. If we have seen the bail out for the same pair many times over a limit, we won&#39;t consider the StoreNode with the same RootNode as store merging candidate again.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/dagcombiner-cpp/#l00192">192</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/dagcombiner-cpp">DAGCombiner.cpp</a>.

### Worklist {#a48c20df4f7280413482b7ca718b6f6b4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;SDNode &#42;, 64&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;DAGCombiner.cpp&#125;::DAGCombiner::Worklist</>}>
Worklist of all of the nodes that need to be simplified.

This must behave as a stack – new nodes to process are pushed onto the back and when processing we pop off of the back.

The worklist will not contain duplicates but may contain null entries due to nodes being deleted from the underlying DAG. For fast lookup and deduplication, the index of the node in this vector is stored in the node in SDNode::CombinerWorklistIndex.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/dagcombiner-cpp/#l00179">179</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/selectiondag/dagcombiner-cpp">DAGCombiner.cpp</a>.
